content.body: we might've accidentally made template literal arrays eternal again?

content.body: we (chrome) recently discovered the note for [[TemplateMap]] in https://tc39.es/ecma262/#table-realm-record-fields is not true, because, well, WeakMaps and WeakRefs exist
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: we (chrome) recently discovered the note for [[TemplateMap]] in https://tc39.es/ecma262/#table-realm-record-fields is not true, because, well, WeakMaps and WeakRefs exist

content.body: It seems to just not be true general. The array could still be reachable by anything live having a reference to it. The array can be passed around. Unless it means the literal accessing of the [[array]] field rather than the value?

* It seems to just not be true in general. The array could still be reachable by anything live having a reference to it. The array can be passed around. Unless it means the literal accessing of the [[array]] field rather than the value?

content.body: good point, i think that note is probably in general wrong

content.body: but the original intention was assuming no live strong references to the template array, we _could_ collect it if the parse node was no longer reachable

content.body: That seems OK? Even if the array is in a WeakRef. Or is there a risk to making that collection observable?
but it is not in fact unobservable to collect them, because of weakrefs
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: but it is not in fact unobservable to collect them, because of weakrefs

content.body: i think we should clarify that note because it's saying a collecting implementation strategy is allowed because of unobservability, which is false
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: i think we should clarify that note because it's saying a collecting implementation strategy is allowed because of unobservability, which is false

content.body: maybe we don't need to say anything more than "it's observable in weak collections and weakrefs and that's fine"

content.body: it's also not very clear to me what a Parse Node becoming unreachable means

content.body: now that we talk about liveness for other things in the spec, we should give these the same treatment

content.body: When can parse nodes be collected? Eval and script tags?
oh no, maybe not, because functions hold on to them?
